titles.title: Earmark Elimination Act of 2011
To prohibit the consideration in the House of Representatives of any legislation containing an earmark.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Rules.

bill.summary: 12/16/2011--Introduced. Earmark Elimination Act of 2011 - Makes it out of order in the House of Representatives to consider a bill, joint resolution, or any other measure that includes a congressional earmark or limited tax or tariff benefit. Makes a conforming amendment to Rule XXI (Restrictions on Certain Bills) of the Rules of the House of Representatives.
